results.title: Harold Lloyd's world of comedy
results.creator_credit: Harold Lloyd and Harold Lloyd Corporation
results.brief_description: Presents a compilation of the best short Harold Lloyd sequences. Films excerpted include: ‘Safety last’, ‘Hot water’, ‘Why worry’, ‘Feet first’, ‘Girl shy’, ‘Movie crazy’, ‘Professor beware’.

results.title: Harold and the purple crayon (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, David Piel, Robert Sagalyn and Stanley Flink
results.brief_description: One evening, Harold decides to go for a walk in the moonlight, but there isn’t any moon, so he takes his purple crayon and draws one. As Harold draws his way out of adventure, children become fascinated by the wondrous magic of his purple crayon. Based on the book by Crockett Johnson. Narrated by Norman Rose. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Harold's fairy tale (K)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Weston Woods Studios and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: Harold draws an enchanted garden, only to discover that nothing can grow there because of the machinations of a giant witch. With the aid of his purple crayon, he defeats the witch and makes the garden bloom again. A delightful animated story for children. Based on the book by Crockett Johnson.

results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Weston Woods Studios and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: A timeless animation revealing what happens when Harold takes his purple crayon and the moon for a walk in an enchanted garden one night. Based on the children’s book by Crockett Jonhston.

results.title: Harnessing the rainbow
results.brief_description: The story of the dyestuffs industry. Special emphasis is placed on the imnportance of reading the tags attached to dyed articles when they are purchased, and the permanence of modern vat dyeing methods is demonstrated.

results.title: Harnessed flames
results.brief_description: The manufacture of iron and steel at Port Kembla; the conversion of coal into coke in the enormous coke ovens; the smelting of iron ore in the blast furnaces to produce cast iron; the use of molten iron and scrap metal in the open hearth furnaces to produce high-grade steel; the rolling and stamping of white-hot ingots reducing the material to convenient shapes and sizes. The film concludes with information on products being planned for the “future” as part of the Australian steel industry. No credits available.

results.title: Harness the wind
results.creator_credit: Derek Lamb, ONF | NFB and Sidney Goldsmith
results.brief_description: The wind is one of the strongest natural forces around us. Because it is generated by temperature differences in air masses, wind power is in fact a form of solar energy. This film traces the history of man’s attempts to control and utilize wind energy, and projects into the future to visualize the potential of wind-power technology. (Awards: Tokyo; New York; Ottawa)

results.title: Harmony Row
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and Frank Thring
results.brief_description: This production stars George Wallace as a policeman who is assigned to Harmony Row, a notorious haunt of thugs and criminals. On the beat he makes many friends and is finally persuaded to fight Slogger Lee, the biggest trouble maker in Harmony Row, in a boxing tournament.
